nodes.bodyText:
In what contexts might this fail? I'm mainly wondering because (IIUC) this adds a new way for rserver to fail to start and just want to make sure we understand the failure modes (and are convinced they're rare or understandable + easy to diagnose).
Alternatively: what do you think about using options.serverUser() by default, and having an error here be a warning rather than fatal? Or would this ultimately just fail somewhere else further down?

The work to get the system::User and the error check for that were done inside file_utils::changeOwnership before. The SDK options class has a Error error = serverUser(system::User& out_user) method, so I wanted this function to take the User object rather than the username.
It should only fail if the server user doesn't exist, which really shouldn't be possible at this point, since a misconfigured rserver.conf should have caused the process to fail much earlier than this.
That makes sense. Thanks!

At any rate, this is the existing behaviour so I doubt it will cause issues if we don't change it.
